reviews.review: This is the game you want to play if you're looking for a memorable game. 10/10.

Наконец-то я нашёл время, чтобы описать эту шедевральную игру. Обычно описания получаются длинными благодаря тому, что акцентируешь внимание на недостатках. Здесь недостатков нет, и потому довольно сложно много и долго о чём-то рассказывать.
Первое и главное - это атмосфера. Она великолепна. Здесь в полной мере передано ощущение того самого заброшенного исследовательского комплекса. Звуки, цвета, такинственные надписи на стенах - в это нужно играть, чтобы прочувствовать.
Второе - озвучка. Уверен, что на английском языке она ещё лучше, но русские переводчики успешно справились. Конечно, речь идёт про ГладОС и все эти замечательные шуточки, которые давно стали классикой.
Третье - сам игровой процесс. Конечно, сам по себе он не вызвал бы никаких особенных эмоций, но здесь он отлично вписывается в атмосферу. Причём он не слишком тяжел, мне не приходилось подолгу залипать на одном месте - уровни выверены очень аккуратно, как раз между удовольствием от прохождения и раздражением от сложности прохождения.
Играть всем в обязательном порядке, это шедевр. 10 тортиков из 10!
Very fun, very simple, physics are nice, and the humor is great. This game is a great start for people new to Steam.
Awesome

Prequel to Portal 2
Es gud?
Jes.

You get a gun to shoot doors on the walls but not all walls so you have to use physics to get to places but once you get to the places you win the level but there are more levels and turrets that shoot at you so you have to make them fall through the doors that you make with the gun there are other hazards to avoid like pools and electricity balls oh and fire but that's different so you need to use the portal gun to get past it but you probably die alot and the computer talks to you and says mean things but you kill the computer so it's ok. Also you use building blocks to get up and press buttons except there called cubes

I ordered this game at the very strong recommendation of a lot of my friends - Portal has always received fantastic reviews, and I'm delighted to say I'm not disappointed in the least! Although I'm not generally one for puzzle style games, I absolutely adore the dry, dark humour and the gameplay, as well as the little universe created.

Portal is a short, yet puzzling and entertaining game. This is what some might call an "oldie but goodie". If you like to be intellectually challenged, entertained, and amused at the same time, try Portal.

Einfach nur ein tolles Spiel!

Nachdem man sich durch alle Testkammern gekämpft hat, um die Grundfähigkeiten zu erlernen (dazu zählt nicht sich selber jagen oder unendlcih lange durch ein Portal an der Decke und eimem auf dem Boden zu fallen xD), muss  man nun GLaDOS, den Computer, der dich gefangen hält aufsuchen. Um zu ihm zu kommen braucht man schon an einigen Stellen ein bischen mehr Grips als es vorher der Fall war. GlaDOS dann noch unter Zeitdruck zu besiegen ist auch nochmal eine Herausforderung für sich.  Manchmal bleibt man zwar für längere Zeit an einer Stelle hängen, aber man sollte nicht gleich aufgeben und die Komplettlösung angucken.

GLaDOS spricht mit sehr viel Humor, ist aber auch manchmal auch ziehmlich ernst und beleidigend. Kleine Easter Eggs sind, wie zum Beispiel eine Präsentation über "Black Mesa" und andere Spiele, natürlich vorhanden.

Die Grafik ist im etwa so, wie bei anderen Spielen von Valve, aber mir zumindest reicht die Grafik vollkommen aus. Das einzige, was besser hätte aussehen können wäre der Hauptcharakter, aber den sieht man in dem meisten Spielen, wo man nicht in der 3rd Person spielen kann,  sowiso nicht (es sei denn, man hat einen Spiegel oder ein Foto). 
Die Sounds sind auch absolut klasse gemacht. An einegen stellen sind sie ein bischen nervig, aber was will man in einem Labor erwarten? 

Es hat sehr viel Spaß gemacht, das Spiel durchzuspielen und ist deshalb mehr als nur empfehlenswert. Und denkt immer daran: "the cake is a lie" !

Gesamtwertung: 10 / 10
Great game

Pasado el Portal en 7 horas. Mis impresiones:

Lo primero, por si alguien tiene dudas acerca de la mecánica de juego: Es un juego enteramente de puzzles. Quiero decir, que cuando acabas el puzzle 1, a continuación pasas al puzzle 2, y luego al puzzle 3... y así hasta el final. No es como otros juegos que son en plan aventura, donde van intercalando los puzzles con otros elementos, como puedan ser exploración, diálogos...

El juego no tiene una historia-argumento "per sé", pero sí que tiene un contexto o un mínimo de hilo conductor que te mantiene el interés para seguir avanzando y no dejar el juego.

Y respecto los puzzles en sí. Si tenéis visión espacial los puzzles son pan comido. La dificultad de éstos, o por lo menos la dificultad que yo he tenido para avanzar, ha sido en aquellos puntos donde hay "saltos con inercia" (con uno del final estuve más de 1 hora intentándolo), y en otros sitios donde cuenta tu habilidad más que el ingenio (tanto medir con precisión los teletransportes, como ejecutarlos con rapidez).

En esencia, los puzzles son una combinación de estos factores: ingenio, visión espacial, habilidad y rapidez en la ejecución de algunos teletransportes.

- Lo que más me ha gustado: su concepto de jugabilidad, el tramo final, y el final. Y a parte, lo ingeniosos que son los puzzles.

- Lo que menos me ha gustado: que no son puzzles ENTERAMENTE de ingenio. También cuenta la habilidad. Factor coordinación, y factor tiempo, también son importantes... Y quería (me hubiera gustado) que sólo fuera de pensar XD

Si no sois muy habilidosos con el teclado o el gamepad, os atraganteréis en algunos puntos, pero a la fuerza de intentar los saltos, y midiendo tiempos, al final sale. Yo lo he jugado con gamepad, pero para algunos puntos en concreto donde me atasqué en algún salto, tuve que usar el teclado y el ratón, porque con gamepad me era imposible.
Short but sweet.

Portal is one of those games you just would not have the heart to delete from your computer or library. The game carries the sense of wanting to replay and think to new ways to try and solve the already beaten puzzles but the only real con to this game is that it IS short, but you can find yourself lost for what seems like hours on end when doing some of the puzzles which is not a bad thing at all. If you find it over youtube or seen your friend play it, the real experience is in playing it yourself. While it is possible to play PORTAL 2 without playing the original, you really don't get the sense of "Hey I seen this before!" or "Oh I remember this trick I did back in one puzzle" Yes there would be times you would find yourself lost and confuse on a puzzle, I would only suggest looking for playthroughs on youtube as a real last resort, I have done this for one puzzle and it did lose abet of magic for me playing a new game the first time, but it was still awesome to play first hand.

Portal is that game that blurs the lines between first-person shooters and puzzle games. The story behind it, intertwined with the story behind the Black Mesa incident, lets you see just how complex the game itself is. Some of the puzzles are quite difficult, but I think that the learning curve isn't too steep-like in games where the first level has no monsters, and the second has 8 different bosses at the same time. This game isn't for everyone, but if you think you might like it, you probably will. It was definitely worth the cost.

Ça faisait longtemps que j'voulais y jouer, mais pas avant d'avoir essayé. Après avoir fait les 3 permiers niveaux chez qq'un, j'ai craqué, et je l'ai enchaîné !! Autant le mode scénario est (très) court, autant il est bien amené, progressif et franchement drôle. 

En revanche, lorsqu'on se met à chasser les succès, Portal change du tout au tout. Il passe alors du statut de "petite beta démo" à un jeu bien plus long et satisfaisant. Il offrira entre autres, difficultés, frustrations, et deviendra donc un sacré challenge pour ceux qui persévéreront.

En bref, un jeu tout à fait recommandable, relativement accessible, qui comblera les gens qui moi souhaitent se tester une nouvelle définition du "S" de FPS (Stratégie, Stress, Surprise, Sueur, Souriez vous êtes Surveillé).

Offers hours of gameplay (if you don't get bored too quickly) which you shouldn't because it's a very enjoyable experience.It (in my opinion) should be rated a 7, purely because of difficulty and a bit of blood. I, was still creeped out by a few levels though, like on one level the are turrets/centry guards, who speak in child like voices saying things like: "are you still there", or "hello" and then they open fire on you. Also when they die they try to reason with and they say "I don't hate you, or "no hard feelings?". GLaDOS also gets a bit creepy making jokes with dark and sinister dialouge about the vital organs of the people in your hometown, or *SPOILER* how she tried to murder you. I got it and all my progress on the game in 2012 and 2014 and the graphics don't seem old at all. Overall Portal is one of my favourite PC games and I have thoroughly enjoyed playing it. 5 stars!!!
(check out "Fission vs Fusion" on Youtube if you have played this game!!!)

2) Понравились персонажи, у них ярко выраженные характеры

2) Отсутствие какой-либо сюжетной линии, вместо них цепь камер, которая заканчивается только в концовке.
Вывод: обязателен к прохождению, особенно если пройден Portal 2.

This game is another innovative masterpiece by Valve, only this time with a different twist. Instead of being able to lift and launch items with the Gravity Gun, you get a neat, a possibly more useful, device known as the Aperture Science Handheld Quantum Tunneling Device, mostly referred to as a Portal Gun. Wow, Valve must like futuristic guns... Anyway, this device can fire a blue portal (left-click) and a red/orange portal (right-click). These portals are spacially linked, so, in simple terms, place something in one portal and it'll exit out of the other. Throughout the game, you are guided through various chambers, which require the use of the Portal Gun, by an automated feminine voice, which belongs to the CPU of the entire facility, known as Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System, or GLaDOS for short. The voice seems to desire to help you, promising you a portion of cake in the end, but can you really trust this machine? With great gameplay, intriguing mechanics, an epic final battle, and an extremely popular credits theme, this game is downright amazing, and I recommend it to any puzzle fanatics or gamers in general. The game only has one flaw: It is rather easy.

One of the many great games designed by Valve, great gameplay and impressive graphics for a game designed in 2007. 
Very clever dynamics and laws of physics, would reccomend this game for people who like to solve puzzles and take on tough challenges.
However, the story needs to be more developed rather than just a few testing chambers.
8/10

This game is tight. Like a well written short story, every piece of this game has a purpose to serve to further the story and ambiance of the world in which the player finds him or herself. The learning curve is perfect. Never did I feel frustrated enough that I needed to walk away for a breather, yet it was still challenging. The humor matches the dark and ruined interiors you find yourself puzzling through, and the mystery and suspense caught me effortlessly. Well done all around, this is one of the best video games ever made.
A great classic by valve, a lot of fun to be found from this charming puzzle game. I would recommend it to anyone who has not played it.
The cake is so delicious. Very enticing. It totally makes doing all those tests worth it. If you haven't played this yet and are in need of the reward of cake, then go no further.
The game was lovely created and it's worth picking this one up before playing Portal 2. The sequel improved significantly an already very good game.

For those that love first person shooter games and puzzles, look no further than Portal. Portal is a game where you take control of a experimental gun known as a portal gun. As the main character, you and your trusty portal gun are run through a series of test chambers directed by the artificial intelligience known simply as Glados. As you progress through each test chamber you will be forced to think outside the box and have a quick reflexes, or face a unfortunate accident in the name of science.
